points: Used Vue in both my web development jobs at Doorr and Genesys
This website was made using Vue as well
Where there is front end there is often JavaScript and at Doorr I used it a lot
This website is also built using JavaScript with Vue
My knowledge is mostly based in web development but I'm pretty confident I could use JavaScript in non-web contexts well
Used Python at Imagine Communications and PlayStation when writing the QA tests
Also have some experience doing scripting with Python both in school and at the jobs mentioned above
All of my experience in C++ is from school classes where it was used in lectures, labs, and projects
Pretty comfortable with the language as a whole since many graded assessments were based entirely in C++
I have used Git everywhere from work to school to even personal projects
Very comfortable with both CLI and GUI Git as I often switch between the two
Also familiar with use of Gitlab (from school) as well as bitbucket (from most jobs)
JIRA, like Git, was used at every job I've worked at so far
Really comfortable with this technology, I've used it many times and understand it pretty thoroughly
Familiar with Confluence from many jobs having all documentation contained in Confluence
Mostly just used for searching for docs and reading them but I have written my own Confluence pages a few times as well
Similar to C++, most of my knowledge of C comes from the classroom in everything from lectures to labs to projects to assignments
Pretty comfortable with this language as well since many of my recent classes have been entirely in C and I feel I have learned a lot about it in that time
TypeScript was used entirely during my work at Genesys so I have a lot of front end experience with it
Similar to JavaScript, I only know TypeScript in the web development context but I'm confident I could use it outside web development as well
I'm very comfortable with HTML as it was used, in conjunction with Vue, at both Doorr and Genesys so I've seen a lot of it
This website itself also uses HTML in conjunction with Vue
CSS isn't just a part of doing web development - it's a necessity - so, needless to say, I've seen and written a lot of CSS code
Most of the time I've actually used extensions of CSS like SCSS or LESS but I'm confident I could use any of them at this point
My experience with Groovy comes from my extensive work with Jenkins at PlayStation
Groovy was used to write the Jenkinsfiles and I did quite a bit of that so I'm pretty familiar with the language
I often use LaTeX when writing out assignments for equation-heavy courses like probability and statistics courses
I've seen and written a lot of LaTeX over the course of my degree so far, so it's safe to say I'm very comfortable with it
My experience with Jenkins comes mostly from PlayStation but it was also used a bit at some of my other jobs as well
At PlayStation I spent about half my time there working on the Jenkins test runs, including writing the Jenkinsfiles as well as ensuring current tests pass
At other jobs Jenkins was mostly used to automate testing or deploying so I have a lot of experience reading Jenkins logs from there
At PlayStation, as well as Genesys, we used Mac OS as our development environment
Also pretty familiar with the OS in general since I've had Macbooks before and used it in school quite a bit
Very familiar with Windows as for upwards of 5 years now it has been the OS of my personal computer
Also used Windows at both Imagine Communications and Doorr while developing
A large part of my job at Doorr was migrating our jQuery components to Vue so I have a lot of experience reading it
I don't have much experience writing jQuery but I have done a little bit of it in both of my previous web development jobs
Visual Studio has been my IDE of choice for both work, school, and personal projects for a long time now
I have a lot of experience using it and am very comfortable with the IDE
